p: On the basis of the results of antimicrobial assays performed on both the extracellular crude extracts, chloroform extract was selected to carry out further studies. The results presented in Table 4 showed that the MIC values varied from 41−164 μg/ ml against the entire test strains. The inhibitory effect of chloroform extract obtained from strain KD155 started at 41 μg/ ml against S. aureus (MTCC 7443), B. cereus (MTCC 6728) and P. aeruginosa (MTCC 424) whereas higher MIC value of 328 μg/ ml was found against B. subtilis (MTCC 441). However, most of the test bacterial organisms were inhibited at concentration of 164 μg/ ml. Apart from this, MIC range of chloroform extract against C. albicans (MTCC 227) was found to be 164 μg/ ml. Chloroform extract of P. aeruginosa KD155 showed potentially bactericidal activity against S. aureus (MTCC 7443), B. cereus (MTCC 6728) and P. aeruginosa (MTCC 424) with MBC of 86 μg/ ml. The fungal pathogen i.e., C. albicans (MTCC 227) was observed sensitive towards higher values of MFCs i.e., 410 μg/ ml ( Table 4) ( Fig. 4).
